definition: to be hell-bent on/dead set on sth/unswerving
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: Then they will always be loyal to him.
sentences.chinese: 然后他们就总会死心塌地的效忠于他了。

sentences.english: These mutual assurances hardened us in the thing.
sentences.chinese: 这种互相的保证使我们死心塌地地干去。

sentences.english: Find a worthy hell-bent person, love.
sentences.chinese: 找一个值得死心塌地的人，好好爱。

sentences.english: Only a handful of people were dead set on following him.
sentences.chinese: 死心塌地跟他走的只是一小撮。

sentences.english: Want to make a man fall head over heels in love with you?
sentences.chinese: 想让男人爱你爱到死心塌地？

sentences.english: Even if one day out of the body, I'm still be dead set.
sentences.chinese: 就算有一天脱离了身体，我依然这样死心塌地。

sentences.english: No wonder the sight of Li Kui Song Jiang to be a dead set with Song Jiang.
sentences.chinese: 难怪李逵一见到宋江就死心塌地的跟定了宋江。

sentences.english: Can make people hell-bent on me.
The way she'd once been so completely in love with Jonathan?
sentences.chinese: 她死心塌地爱上乔纳森的那种爱？

definition: see 死心塌地[si3 xin1 ta1 di4]
delighted to (do sth, idiom)/perfectly happy to do/most willing to do
concentrating one's thoughts and efforts/single-minded/bent on/intently
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
loyal and devoted (idiom); faithful and true
to treat sb favorably/to view in a new light
bowed head and ears glued (idiom); docile and obedient/at sb's beck and call

pinyin: ai4 de5 si3 qu4 huo2 lai2
